chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
T: Ring
k: nat
n: nat
m: nat

Goal:
forall (A B : matrix m n) (C : matrix n k), Mmult (Mplus A B) C = Mplus (Mmult A C) (Mmult B C)

Premises:
matrix = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) => Tn m (Tn n T) : Type -> nat -> nat -> Type Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope]
C = fun n p : nat => INR (fact n) / (INR (fact p) * INR (fact (n - p))) : nat -> nat -> R Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
Mplus = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) (A B : matrix m n) => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => plus (coeff_mat zero A i j) (coeff_mat zero B i j)) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n -> matrix m n -> matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope _ _]
Inductive GFormula (TA TX AA AF : Type) : Type := TT : Tauto.GFormula | FF : Tauto.GFormula | X : TX -> Tauto.GFormula | A : TA -> AA -> Tauto.GFormula | Cj : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | D : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | N : Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula | I : Tauto.GFormula -> option AF -> Tauto.GFormula -> Tauto.GFormula For GFormula: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For TT: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For FF: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For X: Arguments TA, TX, AA, AF are implicit and maximally inserted For A: Arguments TA, TX, AA,
Mmult = fun (n m k : nat) (A : matrix n m) (B : matrix m k) => mk_matrix n k (fun i j : nat => sum_n (fun l : nat => mult (coeff_mat zero A i l) (coeff_mat zero B l j)) (Init.Nat.pred m)) : forall n m k : nat, matrix n m -> matrix m k -> matrix n k Arguments n, m, k are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _]
Mmult_assoc : forall (A : matrix ?n ?m) (B : matrix ?m ?k) (C : matrix ?k ?l), Mmult A (Mmult B C) = Mmult (Mmult A B) C where ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?k : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?l : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
Mplus_assoc : forall A B C : matrix ?m ?n, Mplus A (Mplus B C) = Mplus (Mplus A B) C where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
Mplus_comm : forall A B : matrix ?m ?n, Mplus A B = Mplus B A where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
fst = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (x, _) := p in x : forall A B : Type, A * B -> A Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B For pair: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For pair: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Mopp = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) (A : matrix m n) => mk_matrix m n (fun i j : nat => opp (coeff_mat zero A i j)) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n -> matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope _]
Mplus_zero_r : forall A : matrix ?m ?n, Mplus A Mzero = A where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
Mplus_opp_r : forall A : matrix ?m ?n, Mplus A (Mopp A) = Mzero where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat = fun (T : Type) (m n : nat) (x0 : T) (A : matrix m n) (i j : nat) => coeff_Tn x0 (coeff_Tn (mk_Tn n (fun _ : nat => x0)) A i) j : forall (T : Type) (m n : nat), T -> matrix m n -> nat -> nat -> T Arguments T, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope nat_scope nat_scope _ _ nat_scope nat_scope]
Inductive sumbool (A B : Prop) : Set := left : A -> {A} + {B} | right : B -> {A} + {B} For left, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For left, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument A is implicit For right, when applied to no more than 1 argument: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For right, when applied to 2 arguments: Argument B is implicit For sumbool: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For left: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _] For right: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
mk_matrix_bij : forall (x0 : ?T) (A : matrix ?m ?n), mk_matrix ?m ?n (coeff_mat x0 A) = A where ?T : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Type] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
Mmult_one_l : forall x : matrix ?m ?n, Mmult Mone x = x where ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
Mmult_one_r : forall x : matrix ?m ?n, Mmult x Mone = x where ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P Datatypes.nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A For nil: Arguments are renamed to T For cons: Arguments are renamed to T, x, s For nil: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For cons: Argument T is implicit and maximally inserted For list: Argument scope is [type_scope] For nil: Argument scope is [type_scope] For cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ seq_scope]
mk_matrix : forall m0 n0 : nat, (nat -> nat -> ?T) -> matrix m0 n0 where ?T : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Type]
Mzero = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) => mk_matrix m n (fun _ _ : nat => zero) : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), matrix m n Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
Mone = fun n : nat => mk_matrix n n Mone_seq : forall n : nat, matrix n n Argument n is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [nat_scope]
coeff_mat_ext : forall (x0 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, coeff_mat x0 v1 i j = coeff_mat x0 v2 i j) where ?T : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Type] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
coeff_mat_ext_aux : forall (x1 x2 : ?T) (v1 v2 : matrix ?m ?n), v1 = v2 < -> (forall i j : nat, (i < ?m)%nat -> (j < ?n)%nat -> coeff_mat x1 v1 i j = coeff_mat x2 v2 i j) where ?T : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Type] ?m : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat] ?n : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- nat]
matrix_AbelianGroup = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) => AbelianGroup.Pack (matrix m n) matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin (matrix m n) : AbelianGroup -> nat -> nat -> AbelianGroup Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
matrix_AbelianGroup_mixin = fun (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat) => {| AbelianGroup.plus := Mplus; AbelianGroup.opp := Mopp; AbelianGroup.zero := Mzero; AbelianGroup.ax1 := Mplus_comm; AbelianGroup.ax2 := Mplus_assoc; AbelianGroup.ax3 := Mplus_zero_r; AbelianGroup.ax4 := Mplus_opp_r |} : forall (G : AbelianGroup) (m n : nat), AbelianGroup.mixin_of (matrix m n) Arguments G, m, n are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [_ nat_scope nat_scope]
AbelianGroup.ax4 : forall (G : Type) (m : AbelianGroup.mixin_of G) (x : G), AbelianGroup.plus G m x (AbelianGroup.opp G m x) = AbelianGroup.zero G m
opp_opp : forall x : ?G, opp (opp x) = x where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup]
mult_one_l : forall x : ?K, mult one x = x where ?K : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Ring]
minus_eq_zero : forall x : ?G, minus x x = zero where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup]
mult_zero_l : forall x : ?K, mult zero x = zero where ?K : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- Ring]
plus_zero_r : forall x : ?G, plus x zero = x where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup]
plus_zero_l : forall x : ?G, plus zero x = x where ?G : [T : Ring m : nat n : nat k : nat |- AbelianGroup]

```coq
intros A B C.
unfold Mmult, Mplus.
rewrite <- Mmult_assoc.
apply coeff_mat_ext.
intro i; intro j.
rewrite coeff_mat_ext_aux with (x1:=zero) (x2:=zero); auto.
rewrite!coeff_mat_ext_aux with (x1:=zero) (x2:=zero); auto.
Qed.
```
